item.title: Seventhpost: Day 1 - Database Mockup
item.description: Completely overwhelming with this blog engine: Hugo and Gatsby I miss personal deadline to submit the mockup for both the database and the form for my assignment. It’s day 3 now. And here it is.

item.title: Sixthpost: Moving to Gatsby
item.description: Moving blog engine to Gatsby Gatsby is static generator based on React, here is the link Gatsby Website Based on React component, it’s a good chance to not only learn React in general, but also learn technologies behind a web blog. Plenty new things to learn while learning Gatsby and React: * Markdown (like this one) * NetlifyCMS * Gatsby configuration file based on React syntax (this is one hardest to learn) * and many other things

item.title: Fourthpost
item.description: CSS masih ngga tampil untuk sub-post folder T_T

item.title: Thirdpost: Markdown Cheet-Sheat
item.description: VS Code Markdown Github Mastering Markdown It’s very easy to make some words bold and other words italic with Markdown. You can even link to Google! Sometimes you want numbered lists: One Two Three Sometimes you want bullet points: Start a line with a star Profit! Alternatively, Dashes work just as well And if you have sub points, put two spaces before the dash or star: Like this And this If you want to embed images, this is how you do it:
